name: Atrium Hotel & Suites, DFW Airport South

reviews.text: The nice thing about older hotels, if they are maintained, is that they have some 'throw-back' amenities. For instance, our room was a two room suite with a large, fully furnished sitting/living area upon initial entry. The bedroom was very large as well, much larger than newer hotels. Each room was equipped with a flat screen TV; there was also a small frig, microwave and coffee pot. Unfortunately the Radisson 'dial-a-bed' has never been my favorite for comfort but was acceptable. We attended a seminar here and the hotel catered the meals which were surprisingly good. The hotel lobby area is huge, the first floor actually. It has an odd but functional layout. Our requests for help from the staff were promptly attended. Our meeting area was adequate and the hotel offers van service to the airport and local mall. We received a very competitive internet room rate. For the price the deal would have been hard to beat.
reviews.title: it's fine

reviews.text: My flight ended up being canceled due to a thunder storm and I was warmly welcomed by the staff at this hotel. They were able to find me a room and get me checked in so quickly; I was able to get to my room and unwind right away, flat screen TV, Sleep Number beds...awesome! Also the price was GREAT! I ended up getting two queen beds for $99! I loved the style here too, very unique layout with the pool in the center, very updated and modern. Close to airport and prompt shuttle service.
reviews.title: Modern atmoshphere and great staff

reviews.text: We were in town for a graduation and family in Euless, TX, hotel only 8 minutes away. Booked using "name your price" site at less than half the price on the hotel site at the time. Found rooms to be very clean and updated, indoor pool clean, and breakfast was very good, and staff was friendly and accomodated us with a suite because there were no rooms with a two beds at the time. Very pleasant stay at a very good price. Hotel design is open in middle with rooms on east and west sides with 5 floors.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I was in Dallas visiting family. I stayed at the Park Inn. It was really close to the airport which was great, because I was flying out in the morning. I had a wonderful nights sleep. The room was comfortable and clean. The room service was affordable and the rood was great. My bed was awesome and I didn't hear anything until my wake up call. The airport shuttle was on time and everything was great. I really enjoyed my last night in Dallas because of the Park Inn. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Best Stay In Dallas

reviews.text: We had a wedding group and everyone enjoyed the hotel. my room had sleep number bed, which
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: Beware giving this hotel your credit card! They made unathorized charges to my credit card a week after I checked out. I am referring this to matter to the District Attorney's office. Even despite this event, the hotel is FILTHY and STINKS. My bed sheets had not been changed from the tenant before me (SOMEONE ELSE'S GREASY HAIR IN THE BED). The lobby furniture is so dirty you can't lean back without getting your own hair dirty. The sleep number beds are broken and mine was stuck on "hard". The carpet has been there since ... I'm guessing early 1980s. PLUS... the idiot who took me to the airport got lost taking me to the airport. PLUS... there is not free parking, despite their advertising. PLUS... if you book through Hotwire or otherwise not directly through them, they make up the difference of the room rate by charging your card extra charges you don't authorize. The front desk clerk is rude. The location is terrible and unsafe. Spend the night in your car if this is your only choice.
reviews.title: Hotel stole money through unauthorized charges on my credit card

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 2 night stay here was just perfect. The front desk is so friendly and helpful. There is a free shuttle for the area, as well as a shuttle to the Airport. We did not get a room with the sleep number bed, but the king size bed was so comfortable, we didn't need the sleep number one.
reviews.title: Just perfect!

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was very good. We booked with Hotwire and got a fabulous deal.
reviews.title: Excellent Service for a Seminar

reviews.text: We stopped here to see the Texas Rangers baseball game against the New York Yankees and then continued on New Orleans.
reviews.title: Changing but still a nice place

reviews.text: We loved Dallas and all the friendly Texans we met.
reviews.title: Park Inn, Irving, Texas

reviews.text: I am not too fussy about things but this hotel really needs to step it up in the clean-up department. First, the lobby. My partner and I saw the same pile of spilled popcorn on the floor near the elevator for two days. It was pretty visible yet no one bothered to sweep it up. Second, the carpet in our room looked like a murder scene. It had huge dark stains all over it. Third, the dining area in the restaurant was pretty dirty (tables etc). Finally, dirty dishes from room service were left in the hallways for 12 hours at a time. This gives a really poor impression and made me avoid the swimming pool and other areas of the hotel.
reviews.title: Very dirty rooms and hotel!

reviews.text: That said, the staff were friendly, decor was interesting and our room was quiet. But personally I think I'd stay elsewhere next time. There are plenty of other hotels in this area and most of them are designed to be convenient for the airport.
reviews.title: Impressive

reviews.text: Found Park Inn on Priceline. I was needing a place to stay in between flights. They were very accommodating allowing an early check-in. Check-in was quick. Staff was very friendly. Rooms were large, comfortable, clean. Lobby area was spacious and had a nice bar area. It was well worth the price!
reviews.title: Interesting:)

reviews.text: On my roadtrip from California to North Carolina my sister and i stayed the night here. I never have been to the Park Inn and I was delighted! It was especially spacious in the lobby and in our room. This hotel was spotless, quiet and had a modern twist of design to it! Staff were pleasant.
reviews.title: Very rude front desk clerk

reviews.text: The front desk clerk or manager that was on duty was very rude and lacked any courtesy or people skills.
reviews.title: Conference support was Excellent

reviews.text: The building, amenities, and room were all better than expected given that this is currently a Category 1 Club Carlson property. For a mere 9000 Club Carlson points, I got a weeknight stay at this hotel and was upgraded to a one bedroom suite (from the floor maps, it looks like they have many) for being a member of Club Carlson. The room was similar to what you'd find at an Embassy Suites, with a living room, wet bar, and balcony overlooking the massive glass atrium. I didn't eat at the restaurant in the atrium, but it seemed popular. They put out some free pastries and coffee in the lobby the morning I left for the airport.
reviews.title: Nice place for a points stay.

reviews.text: The shuttle bus drivers both directions were prompt, polite, and helpful. The driver who picked me up from the airport even said he could take me to anywhere I wanted to go within a 5 mile radius of the hotel -- stores, restaurants, etc. I wish I had known before I picked up dinner at the airport!
reviews.title: Good location, close to DFW... cheap beer and comfortable beds

reviews.text: For a quick airport stay, I'd definitely stay at the Park Inn again.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: Stayed here before flying out the next day. The Park Inn in a comfortable hotel, well fitted out with ammenities (i.e. pool, restaurant, bar). Rooms feature flat screens with adjustable beds. Ability to customize it to your personal tastes.
reviews.title: Not what I expected

reviews.text: Was there for St. Patrick's Day, and though the bar was not busy... $4 for a pint in a hotel bar? That's a good deal. And it wasn't Budweiser, but a nice rich Porter. It's all good.
reviews.title: What a deal!

aka: Park Inn By Radisson Dfw Airport South Hotel
description: The Atrium Hotel & Suites features over 100 beautifully appointed oversized guestrooms, each with more than 450 square feet of living area. The spacious two-room suites come complete with separate parlors, balconies and atrium views. The 100% Smoke Free property comes with some awesome amenities, great for the business as well as leisure traveler.Great Convenience at Unbelievable Prices:•24 hour Complimentary Shuttle to and from Airport & 3 mile radius•Indoor Heated Pool•24 Hour Fitness Center•24 Hour Business Center•24 Hour Desk Service•Guest Laundry / Valet Laundry•Atrium Bar & Lounge on Site•Gift Shop on Site•Over 10,000 Sq.Ft Meeting Pl
